_source.body_markdown:
Larry Cohen reports from Iowa:

On a hot Iowa Labor Day weekend, everyone was feeling the Bern!
_source.excerpt_html: Bernie’s Labor Day talk to the New Hampshire AFL-CIO underlined the difference between himself and other candidates. He emphasized his support for the $15 minimum wage, restated his opposition to the Trans Pacific Partnership and, most importantly, connected his support for the expansion of collective bargaining rights to sustainable economic growth.
_source.title: On the Road for Bernie in Iowa

_source.body_markdown: Labor Day is a time for honoring the working people of this country.
_source.excerpt_html: Labor Day is a time for honoring the working people of this country. It is also a time to celebrate the accomplishments of the activists and organizers who fought for the 40-hour work week, occupational safety, minimum wage law, Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid and affordable housing. These working people, and their unions, resisted the oligarchs of their day, fought for a more responsive democracy, and built the middle class. Today we can – and we must – follow their example. It’s time to rebuild the crumbling middle class of our country and make certain that every working person in the …
_source.title: Labor Day 2015: Stand Together and Fight Back
